definition: audible
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: There must be a hole somewhere, I can hear the water slopping about in the bottom of the boat.
sentences.chinese: 一定是哪兒有個洞，我聽得見水在船底流蕩的聲音。

sentences.english: We could hear the director rebuking Jim for being late from work again.
sentences.chinese: 我們聽得見主任在斥辭責吉姆上班又遲到了。

sentences.english: It has made a super stealth plane that cannot be seen or heard by anyone.
sentences.chinese: 它製造了沒人看得見或者聽得見的超級隱形飛機。

sentences.english: Together we've played" Hotel California", you can hear?
sentences.chinese: 我們曾經一起彈唱的《加州旅館》，你還能聽得見麼？

sentences.english: We live within earstot of the factory whistle .
sentences.chinese: 我們住的地方聽得見工廠汽笛聲。

sentences.english: "Hui Fen, " his iterate, "Do you listen so that see me?
sentences.chinese: “惠芬，”他重複說，“你聽得見我嗎？”

sentences.english: A singer must learn to project his voice so as to be heard in a large hall.
sentences.chinese: 須學會把聲音送得遠，使會堂裏的人都聽得見。

sentences.english: The rest of the world hears you.
sentences.chinese: 全世界的人都能聽得見。

sentences.english: I could hear the wives behind the thick door of our inner room, stirring there.
sentences.chinese: 透過厚實的門板，聽得見隔壁房裏衆嬪妃沙沙的聲音。

sentences.english: So loudly did he speak that even people in the next room could hear him .
sentences.chinese: 他講話的聲音那樣大，連隔鄰房子裏的人都聽得見。

sentences.english: Speak louder so that everyone could hear.
sentences.chinese: 大聲點說話，讓大家都聽得見。

sentences.english: I could hear his heavy breathing.
sentences.chinese: 我聽得見他粗重的呼吸。

sentences.english: I can still hear your perpetual calling for me.
sentences.chinese: 我仍舊聽得見她那永恆的召喚。

sentences.english: I could hear the clock on the wall ticking.
sentences.chinese: 我聽得見牆上的鐘在滴答地響。

sentences.english: Or should I just beat the shit out of you until you do hear me.
sentences.chinese: 還是要我把你揍得屁滾尿流了才聽得見？

sentences.english: So loudly did he speak that even people in the next room could hear him.
sentences.chinese: 他講話聲音那麼大，隔壁屋裏的人都聽得見。

definition: lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to shiver
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
sound of gong
sullen/to scowl miserably
needlework/sewing
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
examination room (in a doctor's office)
hum/drone/buzz
chicken coop
the person who shares your bed/partner/spouse
to whisper
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
